metadata.title: CVE-2020-26970 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
When reading SMTP server status codes, Thunderbird writes an integer value to a position on the stack that is intended to contain just one byte. Depending on processor architecture and stack layout, this leads to stack corruption that may be exploitable. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.5.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-26970` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
